com.yantra.ysc.japi.ue

Interface YSCGetExternalDataAccessPolicyOnReadUE


  • public interface YSCGetExternalDataAccessPolicyOnReadUE
    User exit that overrides the default data access policy on read access to entities.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalDataAccessPolicyOnRead(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YSCGetExternalDataAccessPolicyOnReadUE user exit is called prior to a read access to the database only for Access Policy enabled entities.

    • Method Detail

      • getExternalDataAccessPolicyOnRead

        org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalDataAccessPolicyOnRead(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YSCGetExternalDataAccessPolicyOnReadUE user exit is called prior to a read access to the database only for Access Policy enabled entities. When the user exit is implemented, it provides the capability to override the factory setting behavior for access policies. The user exit implementation cannot be used to change the behavior of the module specific data access policies such as Catalog and Pricing. In other words, if the entity belongs to module specific access policies the user exit is not invoked.

        User defined data access policy is applied based on the condition of the user exit output.

        ApplyAccessPolicy Flag Special Conditions Action
        'N' Not Applicable No access policy is applied, grant access to current user.
        'Y' "Entities" or "ComplexQuery" not passed. Internal Data Access Policy is applied, User exit output will not be considered
        'Y' Full output template is passed with a valid ComplexQuery on each Entity User defined access policy is applied.

        In summary, data access is granted to the user if ApplyAccessPolicy='N'. When it is set to Y, user defined filter will be applied only if the user exit output correctly define all entity and complex queries. Otherwise internal data access policy will be applied.

        User Exit Input XML Construction:
        Whenever a data access enabled entity is requested for database access, the access policy manager begins by verifying if this user exit is implemented. If so, the entity and its parent entities information will be converted into an input XML which is then passed to the user exit along with the UserID. If applicable the ClaimAsUserID, and DocumentSearchKey will also be included in the input xml.

        For example, when getOrderLineList is called, the current entity is YFS_ORDER_LINE and its parent entity YFS_ORDER_HEADER. The following input XML will be provided for the user exit: 

           <AccessPolicy UserID="User1" ClaimAsUserID="User5" >
        <Entities>
                <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_LINE" DocumentSearchKey="DocumentSearchKey_01" />
                <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_HEADER" />
        </Entities>
   </AccessPolicy>

        Note that the DocumentSearchKey only appears on the main entity being accessed and does not appear on its parent.

        User Exit Output XML Construction:
        The user exit implementation determines the query it wants to append for data access filter. The resulting filter is required to be return in the ComplexQuery form explained in the API customization guide:Defining Complex Query.

        As an example, during the getOrderLineList API call the user exit output may return:

                <AccessPolicy ApplyAccessPolicy="Y" >
                <Entities>
                        <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_LINE">
                                <ComplexQuery>
                                        <Or>
                                        <And>
                                                        <Exp Name="UnitOfMeasure" Value="EACH"/>
                                                </And>
                                                <Exp Name="OrderHeaderKey" Value="DocumentSearchKey_01"/>
                                        </Or>
                                </ComplexQuery>
                        </Entity>
                        <Entity TableName="YFS_ORDER_HEADER">
                                <ComplexQuery>
                                   <And>
                                     <Exp Name="EnterpriseCode" Value="E1"/>
                                   </And>
                                </ComplexQuery>
                        </Entity>
                </Entities>
        </AccessPolicy>

        *Note: The Operator attribute in ComplexQuery is not supported in this user exit and it should not be passed in the user exit output.

        If applicable, the DocumentSearchKey in the inputXML contains the primary key of the current entity and this information may be also be considered for the data filter.

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called prior to retrieving an entity from the database.

        Post-conditions: The return output xml determines whether external the data access filter is to be applied.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. Any XML document that contains sufficient information about the entity required to create a data filter for access policy. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A valid XML containing the required data filter for data access.. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
